ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The readings and discussions in the class have provided a great perspective on the issues escalating nowadays.
Gained a better understanding of current regional challenges. Was especially helpful to look at the problems each country faces in a comparative perspective.
An overview of the challenges faced by middle eastern states
I learned a great deal about Middle Eastern relations in a time when the topic is extremely relevant and conflicts are rapidly evolving.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Readings are great Discussion is very productive

An in depth analysis of the countries and how they were affected, but it was hard to fully grapple with the material coming from a low knowledge base. Some introductory "who's who" readings might have helped.

I took this course as someone with no background on the Middle East. I think this ended up being a weakness for me, as I often felt like I lacked a lot of information that other classmates did not and this prevented me from fully engaging with and participating in the discussions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. However, it would probably be good to have some Middle East background coming into the course.
I would if it was offered again, and if said person had some background knowledge of the middle east.
I would recommend this course since JJ is a great instructor, but I would warn people who have no background in the subject matter that this might be challenging for them.
